Coffee & Work in Chicago

28 March 2016 on blog

Update (04/10/2016): I guess I was not really done with my "rounds". Added a few more shops :)

Over the past weeks, I've been going around many of the awesome coffee shops that Chicago have, in part to get work done, and in part because I wanted to check them out.

You can find how awesome they are over yelp, but one thing that I wanted to test was their internet speeds (since I had to do some work).

Today, I'm officially done with my rounds. Excluding Starbucks and Whole Foods, here are the results I got:

Name Download (Mbps) Upload (Mbps) Comments
Bourgeois Pig Cafe 7.63 0.93 Open late, every day. Good bites too
Greenbean coffee 13.79 12.55 The americano I tried was not too great, but their food is cheap and in big portions.
Dollop (Clarendon) 31.56 11.71 Huge Dollop, but they had the backroom closed to fix some electrical problem.
Dollop (Damen) 9.15 9.29 The only one with an actual bakery (come at 7am for hot pastries!)
Caffe Streets 13.63 3.46 Could be hard to find seating for larger groups (large group=more than 2 people)
Cup & Spoon 3.04 6.65
Sawada Coffee 64.36 19.39 You have to try their military before you die. Also, bring a hotspot just in case
Cafe Jumping Bean 19.07 3.73 They shutdown their wifi during "rush hours" (lunch time)
Heritage General Store 16.03 ??? You can fix your bike here and their coffee is nice, but is very hard to find a place to sit
Kristoffers 0.59 0.30 Bring your own hotspot cause it was super slow. Also order the Tres Leches
Bridgeport Coffee ??? ??? Bring your own hotspot. And since you'll be in the area, try to grab a potpie at the Pleasant House Bakery across the street
Scone City 7.86 ??? Order a chemex and a scone. Any scone
Intelligentsia (Division) ??? ??? Very crowded. I was not able to connect to the internet
Buzz: Killer Espresso ??? ??? Sit upstairs if there is space. Unless you like darkness. Then sit downstairs.
Star Lounge 15.20 5.69 Their lattes are the best. And their patio "decoration"
Brothers K Coffehouse 0.89 0.20 Mini library to read (or hide behind :p)
Unicorn Cafe 8.16 1.04 Home made muffins and scones
Warm Belly 29.96 11.26 Free parking around it (if you can find a spot)
Volumes Bookcafe 28.40 12.06 By far the best alternative to B&N Starbucks (and some other coffee shops)
La Strada 5.21 0.60 Small, but yummy empanadas available!!
Ipsento 33.41 23.05 Like Bridgeport Coffee, but with a faster wifi :)
Other Brother 14.83 3.19 Smaller than Brothers K, but with weirder (in a good sense) baristas
Jackalope Coffee 32.54 6.70 Unicorn sandwiches!

Tests were made at random times and days, so YMMV. I used speedtest and PureVPN (which also affects the test results)

Other places I went to (but can't find the stats for their wifi): Atomix, Osmium, Wormhole, Filter, Dollop (downtown), Bow Truss, Sip, Intelligentsia (Broadway), The Grind, Next Door, etc.

PS> In general, Starbucks have pretty good wifi in Chicago (thanks to Google), so it is a good alternative if you are not too much into fancy coffees. Whole Foods are better options for food and other drinks (wine, craft beers, pizza!), with plenty of plugs for your electronics, though their wifi could be slow.

54chi
